result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph G. Califf Jr.

records.addlTxt:
9:46 AM cases 22CF133, 22CF804, 22CF1129 called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joseph G. Califf Jr. in court, in custody with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard. Defense waives reading of the complaint in 22CF1129. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/31/2022 at 1:45 PM
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

11:29am Defendant Joseph Califf Jr. appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler.  Attorney Fran Rivard appeared in the courtroom. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Bond is set. 
Attorney Rivard represents the Defendant on 2 other cases that will come before the court 10/11/22 at 9:30am This case will be scheduled with those.

Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
